channel.title: Bad signature for Whonix workstation 9.2
channel.description:
Hi,
I successfully downloaded Whonix Gateway 9 and checked the signing key using kgpg. That worked fine.
However when I checked the signing key for Whonix Workstation a few days ago using kgpg, I got a Bad Signature message in kgpg. I tried again today with version 9.2 and its key, same bad signature result. The site I'm downloading from is https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Download.
Is everything okay with the key for the latest version on your side?
Edit: I also tried to verify using GPG in Ubuntu and got this message:
gpg: Signature made Fri 26 Sep 2014 11:11:30 PM UTC using RSA key ID 77BB3C48 gpg: BAD signature from "Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>"

item.title: Bad signature for Whonix workstation 9.2
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Just downloaded myself. Works for me.

gpg: Signature made Sat 27 Sep 2014 01:11:30 AM CEST using RSA key ID 77BB3C48 gpg: Good signature from "Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>" [unknown] gpg: WARNING: This key is not certified with a trusted signature! gpg: There is no indication that the signature belongs to the owner. Primary key fingerprint: 916B 8D99 C38E AF5E 8ADC 7A2A 8D66 066A 2EEA CCDA Subkey fingerprint: 6E97 9B28 A6F3 7C43 BE30 AFA1 CB8D 50BB 77BB 3C48

Read full topic

item.title: Bad signature for Whonix workstation 9.2
item.dc:creator: fencepole
item.description:
Hi,

I successfully downloaded Whonix Gateway 9 and checked the signing key using kgpg. That worked fine.

However when I checked the signing key for Whonix Workstation a few days ago using kgpg, I got a Bad Signature message in kgpg. I tried again today with version 9.2 and its key, same bad signature result. The site I’m downloading from is https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Download.

Is everything okay with the key for the latest version on your side?

Edit: I also tried to verify using GPG in Ubuntu and got this message:

gpg: Signature made Fri 26 Sep 2014 11:11:30 PM UTC using RSA key ID 77BB3C48
gpg: BAD signature from “Patrick Schleizer adrelanos@riseup.net”
